thread.title: 2015-16 NBA Season Preview : Off-Season Winners & Losers
thread.title_full: 2015-16 NBA Season Preview : Off-Season Winners & Losers

author: TZ McD
title: 2015-16 NBA Season Preview : Off-Season Winners & Losers
text:
By TZ McD ( @ ) on 
Lebron James is simply an amazing athlete. He isn’t the greatest NBA player of all-time, neither is Michael Jordan, Magic Johnson, Kobe Bryant, or Bill Russell. No one is. And that is how it should be. Yes, you can make a case for each of the players listed above but the one thing you cannot do is prove it. Unless MJ, Magic, Mr.Russell, and Lebron James played during the same ERA, it is an argument that should make NBA fans sick. 
Enjoy Lebron James while he is still playing in the NBA. Stop hating a man for dominating a sport. The 2015 NBA Finals should have been the moment the World realized just how incredible of a player Lebron James is. He single handily led his team to a 2-1 series lead. He turned guys like Matthew Dellavedova into a 20 point scorer during the NBA Finals. That in itself blows us away. The Dell isn’t a bad player but did you honestly think anyone predicted he would be starting in the NBA Finals let alone drop 20 in a Game 3 victory? 
Now with the 2015-16 NBA Season swiftly approaching, let’s take a look at the NBA teams that won the off-season and those that lost. 2015 Off-Season Winners 
Additions: LaMarcus Aldridge, David West, Jimmer Fredette 
Re-Signed: Kawahi Leonard, Tim Duncan, Manu Ginoboli, Danny Green 
Incoming Rookies: Nikola Milutinov, Cady LaLanne 
When LaMarcus Aldridge made it official, the entire country went nuts. There are a couple things everyone needs to realize now that the Spurs have added two All-Star big men to their lineup. First off, Tim Duncan can basically rest all season long and be ready to go come playoff time. Secondly, and this is the most important, the Spurs can compete against anyone even with all the aging Stars on their roster. Cleveland Cavaliers 
Additions: Mo Williams, Richard Jefferson 
Re-Signed: Lebron James, Kevin Love, Iman Shumpert, J.R. Smith, Timothy Mozgov 
Incoming Rookies: Cedi Osman, Rakeem Christmas, Sir’Dominic Pointer 
The one year contract for Lebron James was not much of a shocker but when Kevin Love signed for 5 years and $113 million, the ground began to move. Keeping Kevin Love was one of the best move the Cavs organization has made since, well, Lebron James came back. 
They also gave Iman Shumpert a long term deal, one that he deserves.   underrated players on the Cavs roster and they made sure that he stayed there. Adding both Mo Williams and Richard Jefferson helps a depth chart that was lacking experience. Toronto Raptors 
Additions: DeMarre Carroll, Bismack Biyombo, Cory Joseph, Luis Scola 
Incoming Rookies: Delon Wright, Norman Powell 
They got mean. The Raptors added a bunch of guys that will help them go from one-year wonders to serious contenders in the Eastern Conference. Luis Scola is old but plays hard. DeMarre Carroll is a beast and plays like one. They are going to do exactly what they did last season only this time, they might actually be able to beat the Cavaliers in the playoffs. Dallas Mavericks 
Additions: Deron Williams, JaVale McGhee, Wesley Matthews, John Jenkins, Jeremy Evans 
Re-Signed: Raymond Felton, J.J. Barea 
Incoming Rookies: Justin Anderson, Satnam Singh 
Deron Williams was once the best scoring PG in the NBA. At some point, the rest of us forgot and his stock dropped. He became a ball hog that shot way too much and no one appreciated his talents. So he got away from Brooklyn and went back home to Dallas. If only they could have convinced DeAndre Jordan to sign. Milwaukee Bucks 
Additions: Greg Monroe, Chris Copeland, Khris Middleton 
Incoming Rookies: Rashad Vaughn 
Losses: Jared Dudley, Caron Butler 
The losses in Milwaukee are nothing. Caron Butler is getting up there in age and Jared Dudley was traded away for a reason. So the Bucks decided to go out and sign Greg Monroe to help solidify their front court. They also added Chris Copeland and Khris Middleton. Copeland has been underutilized from day one and Middleton is about to go off in Milwaukee this season. 
They have a potential starting rotation of Michael Carter-Williams (PG), Khris Middleton (SG), Giannis Antetokounmpo (SF), Jabari Parker (PF), Greg Monroe (C). That is enough to make the playoffs in the Eastern Conference this season, the only question is if they will get there as a 4th or a 5th seed. (Yes sir, you heard that right) 2015 Off-Season Losers
